chunks.chunk_text: Hello 同情家族歡迎收聽 Look Back Sunday在這個節目John老師會彙整過去不同國家與主題的熱門跟讀文章讓你可以在15分鐘內吸收最精華的世界史詩曲文Let's get right to it!
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: And is partnering with NASA to keep astronauts' spacesuits fresh, even on Mars.Company and NASA scientists have created a fully degradable detergent that will clean clothes without wasting water.Over the next decade, they'll be testing fabric care products including tight pins and wipes at the International Space Station and on missions to the Moon and Mars.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: The months or even years that astronauts spend away from Earth means that their spacesuits and clothes can become smelly and stained.Clothes have to be reworn several times before they are ejected with other waste into the atmosphere or sent back to Earth as trash.A crew member will receive 160 pounds of clothes per year through resupply shipments.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: The head of Russia's space agency said Friday that
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: it will be a reusable space complex, noting that it will be possible to use its first stage at least 100 times.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: This is what SpaceX colleagues are doing, but surpass them.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: Hanks, who appeared to promote his new movie Finch, mimicked shaking in a rocket while in his chair, saying,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: William Shatner says Prince William is missing the point of space tourism.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: The 90-year-old Star Trek actor said that a power-generating base
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: on space tourism in an interview Thursday with the BBC, saying they should invest more time and money in saving Earth.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: The former head of National Space Council told the Associated Press that was before Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine on Thursday last week, however.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: Now the director of the Space Policy Institute at George Washington University said the space station has been largely isolated from political events.It's possible to imagine a break with Russia that would endanger the space station, but that would be at the level of a dropping diplomatic relations, said Pace.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: The space station, an international partnership of five space agencies from 15 countries, including Canada, several countries in Europe, Japan, Russia and the United States, launched in 1998 and morphed into a complex that's almost as long as a football field, with 13 kilometers of electrical wiring, an acre of solar panels and three high-tech labs.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: It marked two decades of people continuously living and working in orbit in 2020.The first crew, American Bill Sheppard and Russians Sergey Krikalev and Yuri Getsenko, blasted off from Kazakhstan on October 31st, 2000.The three astronauts got along fine, but tension sometimes bubbled up with the two mission controls in Houston and outside the country.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json

chunks.chunk_text: Russia kept station crews coming and going after NASA's Columbia disaster in 2003 and after the space shuttles retired in 2011.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_回顧星期天LBS - 太空相關時事趣聞 2023 All About Space.json
